body_content.explanation: one of the two parts of the body at each side of the neck that join the arms to the rest of the body:
examples: I rested my head on her shoulder.
Then she put her arm around my shoulder and gave me a kiss.
She glanced nervously over her shoulder to make sure no one else was listening.

body_content.explanation: the top part of a person's back:
examples: He was about six feet tall with broad shoulders.
"I don't know what to do about it," said Martha, shrugging her shoulders.

body_content.explanation: the parts of a piece of clothing that cover the wearer's shoulders:
examples: The shoulders look a little tight. Do you want to try a larger size?

body_content.explanation: the part of a bottle that curves out below its opening
used to refer to the responsibility that someone has or feels for something:
examples: A huge burden was lifted from my shoulders (= I became much less worried) when I told my parents about my problem.
Responsibility for the dispute rests squarely on the shoulders of the president.

body_content.explanation: a piece of meat that includes the upper part of an animal's front leg:
examples: I've bought a shoulder of lamb for Sunday lunch.

body_content.explanation: an area along the side of a main road where cars can stop:
examples: There were tire tracks left in the soft shoulder (= area of dirt or grass by the road).

body_content.explanation: to accept that you are responsible for something bad or difficult:
examples: It is women who mainly shoulder responsibility for the care of elderly and disabled relatives.
Teachers cannot be expected to shoulder all the blame for poor exam results.

body_content.explanation: to put something on your shoulders to carry it:
examples: Shouldering her pack, she strode off up the road.

body_content.explanation: to push something with one of your shoulders:
examples: She was carrying two suitcases and had to shoulder the door open.
He shouldered his way (= formed a way through by pushing with his shoulders) to the front of the crowd to get a better look.
